docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Monday sided with an anti-abortion group in its challenge of a key birth control provision of the Obama administration's health care overhaul.

headline.main: Judge Sides With Anti-Abortion Group in Birth Control Case
headline.print_headline: Judge Sides With Anti-Abortion Group in Birth Control Case

docs.snippet: A federal judge on Monday sided with an anti-abortion group in its challenge of a key birth control provision of the Obama administration's health care overhaul.

docs.lead_paragraph: A board that oversees New Mexico's largest school district unanimously voted Monday to accept the resignation of its embattled superintendent, who hired an administrator charged with child sex abuse in Colorado.

headline.main: Board Accepts Albuquerque School Chief's Resignation
headline.print_headline: Board Accepts Albuquerque School Chief's Resignation

docs.snippet: A board that oversees New Mexico's largest school district unanimously voted Monday to accept the resignation of its embattled superintendent, who hired an administrator charged with child sex abuse in Colorado.

docs.lead_paragraph: Singapore said Monday it has lifted a two-decade ban on HIV-infected people from entering the country, but will limit their stay to a maximum of three months.

headline.main: Singapore Softens Ban on HIV-Positive Visitors
headline.print_headline: Singapore Softens Ban on HIV-Positive Visitors

docs.snippet: Singapore said Monday it has lifted a two-decade ban on HIV-infected people from entering the country, but will limit their stay to a maximum of three months.

docs.lead_paragraph: Returning from her summer break in mid-August, German Chancellor Angela Merkel raised some eyebrows by describing Europe's refugee problem as a bigger challenge than the Greece crisis, which had overshadowed all else in the first half of 2015.

headline.main: Analysis-Refugee Crisis Suddenly Merkel's Biggest Challenge
headline.print_headline: Analysis-Refugee Crisis Suddenly Merkel's Biggest Challenge

docs.snippet: Returning from her summer break in mid-August, German Chancellor Angela Merkel raised some eyebrows by describing Europe's refugee problem as a bigger challenge than the Greece crisis, which had overshadowed all else in the first half of 2015.

docs.lead_paragraph: As some Republican candidates have shown, it’s not too difficult to fool many of the people for quite a long time.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column contends that phenomenon of cults of personality built around undeserving politicians seems to be exemplified by continuing appeal of Donald Trump to Republican party's base; argues anyone predicting short 2016 presidential run for Trump are ignoring lessons of history and reality, which show that some unqualified and blustering fools have in fact conned American public for very long time.
docs.snippet: As some Republican candidates have shown, it’s not too difficult to fool many of the people for quite a long time.

docs.lead_paragraph: At the Barclays, Day, 27, collected his second consecutive victory, his third title in four starts and his fifth top-10 finish since mid-June.

headline.main: Shedding Underachiever Label, Jason Day Wins Again and Has FedEx Cup in Sight
headline.print_headline: Shedding Underachiever Label, Day Wins Again and Has FedEx Cup in Sight

docs.abstract: Jason Day defies underachiever image, winning Barclays with 6-stoke lead for his fourth PGA Tour  victory of season.
docs.snippet: At the Barclays, Day, 27, collected his second consecutive victory, his third title in four starts and his fifth top-10 finish since mid-June.

docs.lead_paragraph: Doctors find it difficult to ignore patients’ complaints about statins, which are much cheaper, even though clinical trials have found that they have minimal side effects.

headline.main: New Alternatives to Statins Add to a Quandary on Cholesterol
headline.print_headline: New Drugs Add to a Quandary on Cholesterol

docs.abstract: Two newly-approved cholesterol-lowering drugs, Praluent and Repatha, may offer solution for patients who fear side effects of commonly prescribed statins; cost of drugs, over $14,000 per year, adds to quandary for doctors, who must consider full impact on patients' lives of lifelong medicines they prescribe (Series: Mending Hearts).
docs.snippet: Doctors find it difficult to ignore patients’ complaints about statins, which are much cheaper, even though clinical trials have found that they have minimal side effects.

docs.lead_paragraph: A lineup of citywide volunteer projects, prayer services, festivals and parades marked what was an unseasonably mild day 10 years after the storm made landfall.

headline.main: A Decade After Katrina, New Orleans Is Partying Again, and Still Rebuilding
headline.print_headline: A Decade After Katrina, New Orleans Is Partying Again, and Still Rebuilding

docs.abstract: New Orleans marks tenth anniversary of Hurricane Katrina with citywide parades, prayer services and political rally featuring Bill Clinton; optimism encouraged by civic and business leaders contrasts with survivors' ghastly memories and worries that ongoing process of rebuilding might be overlooked amid celebration.
docs.snippet: A lineup of citywide volunteer projects, prayer services, festivals and parades marked what was an unseasonably mild day 10 years after the storm made landfall.

docs.lead_paragraph: Decades before Caitlyn Jenner, Phyllis Frye was grappling with bias, scorn and personal pain, and helping the transgender movement take shape.

headline.main: Once a Pariah, Now a Judge: The Early Transgender Journey of Phyllis Frye
headline.print_headline: Once a Pariah, Now a Transgender Judge

docs.abstract: Judge Phyllis Randolph Frye of Houston, who came out as transgender in 1976, has for decades been on vanguard of transgender civil rights movement; Frye is enthusiastic about rising mainstream awareness of nation's transgender community, but is well-versed in history of movement, emphasizing that gender identity issues did not suddenly materialize with the very public transition of Caitlyn Jenner.
docs.snippet: Decades before Caitlyn Jenner, Phyllis Frye was grappling with bias, scorn and personal pain, and helping the transgender movement take shape.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Special-purpose trusts can be used to provide children a semblance of the life they might have enjoyed without mental illness or addiction, but these trusts can be complicated to establish.

headline.main: For Parents With Troubled Adult Children, Financial Hurdles Abound
headline.print_headline: Financial Hurdles Abound for Parents of Troubled Children

docs.abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column says financial problems are many for parents of troubled children and offers advice on coping.
docs.snippet: Special-purpose trusts can be used to provide children a semblance of the life they might have enjoyed without mental illness or addiction, but these trusts can be complicated to establish.
